posts.post_content:
Posted By: Scott Levy
Ladies and Gents,

I am breaking up our T206 graded set (#12 PSA) and looking to purchase a higher grade raw lot/lots of T206 cards.

All cards EXCEPT the Demmitt and Cobb Green are available.  Since I don't have the time or patience to individually price all cards, let's just say that if your offer is at or above the average recent sale price for the card in its grade I will very likely accept it.

Please respond via email to scottglevy@yahoo.com
(I don't have scans of these cards but have been very diligent to pursue sharp and reasonably well centered cards -- if your card is a major star and a scan is requested I will do my best to get you one).

No discounts on single card purchases -- however, discounts on large lots (e.g. 20 or so cards will be considered and likely given).

Please see the link below for details -- thanks for looking!
[url]http://www.psacard.com/SetRegistry/publishedset.aspx?s=2208[/url]

Regards,
Scott

Posted By: gil lindgren
Scott

Quick delivery and great looking cards.

Posted By: DAN
I am new to the board and getting back into collecting again,  I have some cards and I can tell that you are an expert.  I am interested in getting a Cobb with the green backgound. What should I do, sorry to sound clueless, but I am. I just posted a few cards on my PSA set registry under AKRON, I have another 160 or so raw t206s and want to trade to get the cobb.  I have also the Weimer ghost and a Kruger scrap card.

any direction from you or help in aquiring the Cobb would be appreciated.
thx,  dan

Posted By: Scott Levy
Thanks for your compliment Dan.  I would be happy to chat with you and sent you an email with my contact info.  I'm not the only expert on here -- so many of the people on Net54 are very knowledgeable.  

The direct answer to your question is that it depends heavily on what your goals are.  If you're looking to compete on the registry, you'd want a respectable graded example.  If you're looking to resell -- you have to be very concerned about the cost of the card and resale potential.  Of course there are many other possibilities as well.

Regards,
Scott

Posted By: larry
scott,

thanks for the great service and the great looking cards. you'll hear from me very soon!!
